origin: Mid 18th century from obsolete stale (from Anglo-Norman French estale ‘position’, from estaler ‘be placed’) + mate.

definitions.definition: A situation in which further action or progress by opposing or competing parties seems impossible.
definitions.example: the war had again reached stalemate

definitions.definition: A position counting as a draw, in which a player is not in check but cannot move except into check.
definitions.example: last time I played him it ended up in stalemate

definitions.definition: Bring to or cause to reach stalemate.
definitions.example: the group played a key role in stalemating the negotiations
